text.__SUMMARY__: Croton texensis (common names Texas croton, goat weed, skunk weed, and doveweed), is a plant found in the United States.
text.Uses:
Among the Zuni people, a decoction of the plant taken for "sick stomach", as a purgative, and as a diuretic. An infusion is also taken for stomachaches, for syphilis, and for gonorrhea. The fresh or dried root is chewed by a medicine man before sucking snakebite and a poultice is applied to the wound. The whole plant can be placed under the mattress or burned to repel bedbugs.
